subject: Maintenance Discrepancy Report - Fuselage C Corrosion Discovery
content:
Dear Maintenance Control/Engineering Team,

I am submitting a Maintenance Discrepancy Report (MDR) for an issue noted on **August 3rd, 2025**, during a scheduled 12-month inspection of the airframe.

The defect is logged under the operational system as **MAINT-FUS-20250803-003**.

**Observed Discrepancy (Equipment: Fuselage C):**

Corrosion has been discovered in a secondary structural area on **Fuselage C**, specifically near the **cargo door sill**. The corrosion appears to be **pitting corrosion** and is classified as **Level 2** (Corrosion Beyond Initial Limits) in a localized area measuring approximately $2 	ext{ cm} 	imes 5 	ext{ cm}$.

**Action Taken/Request (Required Procedure: Apply anti-corrosion treatment and inspect panels):**

Photos have been taken and attached, and the area has been temporarily sealed to prevent further moisture ingress.

I kindly request immediate action for the specified procedures: **Apply anti-corrosion treatment** to the affected area, followed by a detailed **tap-test and visual inspection of adjacent structural panels** to ensure the corrosion has not spread beyond the initial point of discovery. Engineering authorization may be required for material removal or patch application.

**Contact Information:**

**Aircraft Location:** Maintenance Bay 1, Paint Shop Area
**Contact Name:** David Lee, Quality Inspector
**Phone:** (555) 444-2222
**Email:** david.lee@airmaint.com

Thank you for your prompt attention. This issue requires detailed analysis to ensure the structural integrity of the airframe remains within safety limits.

Sincerely,
David Lee
Quality Inspector
